title: Ambidexterity Field Guide Specimen
description: A single organizational specimen documenting how an organization structures AI exploration and execution.

name.description: Display name of the organization. e.g. 'Eli Lilly', 'Google X'

title.description: Short descriptive title for the specimen. e.g. 'Decentralized Domain Hubs', 'The Moonshot Factory'

classification.description: Taxonomy classification along two dimensions: structural model and ambidexterity orientation.

structuralModel.description: Primary structural model. 1=Research Lab, 2=Center of Excellence, 3=Embedded Teams, 4=Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke, 5=Product/Venture Lab, 6=Unnamed/Informal, 7=Tiger Teams

structuralModelName.description: Human-readable name for the primary structural model

subType.description: Sub-type if applicable. 5a=Internal Incubator, 5b=Venture Builder, 5c=Platform-to-Product, 6a=Enterprise-Wide Adoption, 6b=Centralized-but-Unnamed, 6c=Grassroots/Bottom-Up

secondaryModel.description: Secondary structural model if hybrid. e.g. Eli Lilly is Model 1 + Model 5b

secondaryModelName.description: Human-readable name for the secondary model

confidence.description: Classification confidence. High=multiple confirming sources. Medium=reasonable but incomplete. Low=best guess from limited data.

classificationRationale.description: Explanation of why this classification was chosen, especially if non-obvious or Medium/Low confidence.

typeSpecimen.description: True if this is the clearest reference example of its structural model.

habitat.description: Environmental conditions — industry, size, geography. Enables the Situation Matcher.

sector.description: More specific sector within industry. e.g. 'E-commerce', 'Cloud Infrastructure'

headquarters.description: HQ location. e.g. 'Indianapolis, IN', 'Mountain View, CA'

description.description: 2-3 paragraph narrative description of how this org structures AI exploration and execution. What does it actually look like? Be specific.

observableMarkers.description: How you'd recognize this structural form in the wild.

reportingStructure.description: Who reports to whom. e.g. 'Hubs report to R&D leadership, not BU heads'

resourceAllocation.description: Budget and headcount patterns. e.g. '20-25% of revenue to R&D'

timeHorizons.description: Planning and delivery cycles. e.g. 'Decades, not quarters'

decisionRights.description: Who decides what. e.g. 'Hub leaders have significant autonomy'

metrics.description: Key quantitative metrics. e.g. '95% daily AI usage, 30K+ active users'

mechanisms.description: Which of the 10 cross-cutting mechanisms this specimen demonstrates.

evidence.description: How this specimen demonstrates the mechanism. Specific, sourced.

strength.description: How clearly the mechanism is demonstrated

quotes.description: Verbatim quotes from leaders with full attribution.

date.description: Date of the quote (source date, not collected date). ISO format preferred.

layers.description: Historical layers (stratigraphy). Most recent first. Each layer represents a point-in-time state of the organization's approach. Layers are additive — never delete, only add.

date.description: When this state was revealed by the org. YYYY-MM format. e.g. '2026-01'

label.description: Short label for the layer. e.g. 'NVIDIA Partnership', 'Hub Structure Detailed'

summary.description: What this layer represents. What was new or changed.

classification.description: Classification at this point in time, if different from current. e.g. 'Model 1' before becoming 'Model 1 + 5b'

sourceRefs.description: References to source IDs in the sources array.

sources.description: All sources for this specimen. Every fact must trace to a source.

id.description: Unique source reference ID within this specimen. e.g. 'cheeky-pint-2025', 'nvidia-pr-2026'

name.description: Source name. e.g. 'Cheeky Pint Podcast', 'NVIDIA Press Release'

url.description: URL to source. Required unless behind paywall or unavailable.

timestamp.description: For audio/video: timestamp where relevant content appears. e.g. '23:45'

sourceDate.description: When the org revealed/disclosed this info (as-of date). YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM.

collectedDate.description: When we captured this in the herbarium. YYYY-MM-DD.

contingencies.description: How this specimen scores on the 5 key contingency variables. Used by the Situation Matcher.

regulatoryIntensity.description: Level of regulatory burden on the organization

timeToObsolescence.description: How quickly the core business faces disruption

talentMarketPosition.description: Ability to attract and retain AI talent

tensionPositions.description: Where this specimen falls on the 5 core tensions. Scale: -1.0 (Pole A) to +1.0 (Pole B). Used for the Tension Map visualization.

structuralVsContextual.description: -1 = fully structural separation, +1 = fully contextual integration

speedVsDepth.description: -1 = deep validation before deploy, +1 = fast wide deployment

openQuestions.description: What remains unclear about this specimen. Guides future research.

taxonomyFeedback.description: Observations about how this specimen fits (or doesn't fit) the taxonomy. Informs taxonomy evolution.

meta.description: Specimen metadata for registry and tracking.

status.description: Active=maintained, Stub=minimal data, Archived=no longer tracking

created.description: When this specimen was first created. YYYY-MM-DD.

lastUpdated.description: When this specimen was last updated. YYYY-MM-DD.

completeness.description: High=multiple sources, mechanisms documented, quotes. Medium=core structure understood, some gaps. Low=stub, insufficient detail.

convertedFrom.description: If converted from old format, the original file path. e.g. 'library/cases/eli-lilly.json'
